verses.kjv: This is a true saying, If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.
verses.ct: Here is a trustworthy statement: if someone aspires to serve as an overseer, they are pursuing a worthy task.

verses.kjv: A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, vigilant, sober, of good behaviour, given to hospitality, apt to teach;
verses.ct: So an overseer must be above reproach, faithful to one spouse, self-controlled, level-headed, respectable, welcoming to strangers, and skilled at teaching.

verses.kjv: Not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre; but patient, not a brawler, not covetous;
verses.ct: He must not be a heavy drinker or violent, and not obsessed with money. Instead, he should be gentle, peaceable, and free from the love of wealth.

verses.kjv: One that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity;
verses.ct: He must manage his own family well, with children who respect and obey him.

verses.kjv: (For if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?)
verses.ct: (After all, if someone can't manage his own family, how could he possibly care for God's church?)

verses.kjv: Not a novice, lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the devil.
verses.ct: He must not be a new convert, or he might become inflated with pride and fall under the same judgment as the devil.

verses.kjv: Moreover he must have a good report of them which are without; lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.
verses.ct: On top of that, he must have a good reputation among outsiders, so that he doesn't fall into disgrace and the devil's trap.

verses.kjv: Likewise must the deacons be grave, not doubletongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre;
verses.ct: In the same way, deacons must be dignified, sincere in what they say, not heavy drinkers, and not chasing after dishonest profit.

verses.kjv: Holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.
verses.ct: They must hold on to the deep truths of the faith with a clear conscience.

verses.kjv: And let these also first be proved; then let them use the office of a deacon, being found blameless.
verses.ct: They should also be tested first, and then if they prove to be above reproach, let them serve as deacons.

verses.kjv: Even so must their wives be grave, not slanderers, sober, faithful in all things.
verses.ct: Their wives, likewise, must be dignified, not gossips, but self-controlled and trustworthy in everything.

verses.kjv: Let the deacons be the husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.
verses.ct: Deacons must be faithful to one spouse and manage their children and households well.

verses.kjv: For they that have used the office of a deacon well purchase to themselves a good degree, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: Those who serve well as deacons gain an excellent standing for themselves and great confidence in their faith in Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: These things write I unto thee, hoping to come unto thee shortly:
verses.ct: I'm writing these instructions to you with the hope of coming to see you soon.

verses.kjv: But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.
verses.ct: But if I'm delayed, I want you to know how people should conduct themselves in the household of God, which is the church of the living God â€” the pillar and foundation of the truth.

verses.kjv: And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen of angels, preached unto the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory.
verses.ct: Beyond any dispute, the mystery at the heart of godliness is profound: He appeared in a human body, was vindicated by the Spirit, was seen by angels, was proclaimed among the nations, was believed in throughout the world, and was taken up into glory.
